title: US report on Abu Akleh killing must be made public, senator urges
description: Chris Van Hollen says though US did not conduct independent investigation, gov't report provides 'important insights'.

title: ‘Pathetic man’: California gov slams DeSantis over migrant flight
description: Top California official suggests Florida governor guilty of kidnapping after asylum seekers flown to US state's capital.

title: Honduran president set to visit China after establishing ties
description: President Xiomara Castro continues to expand Honduras's relations with Beijing as the country seeks an economic boost.

title: Former FBI agent who spied for Soviet Union dies in US jail
description: Robert Hanssen had pleaded guilty to spying for the Soviet Union and then Russia for more than 20 years in major breach.

title: Is the war in Ukraine entering a critical stage or a new phase?
description: Will attacks on border regions, civilian casualties and drone strikes bring a major change in the war's direction?

title: Scientists say world’s oldest-known burial site found in S Africa
description: The site in the Cradle of Humankind near Johannesburg contains remains of a small-brained distant relative of humans.

title: Israel bombed this Gaza house, turning antique collection to dust
description: Gaza man visits his house destroyed in Israeli bombing in the hope of retrieving his treasured antique collection.

title: Saudi Arabia privatises football clubs, eyes big-name signings
description: Saudi Arabia aims to increase the revenue of its football league and bring it up to 'top 10 in the world'.

title: Will Apple’s sleek new VR goggles be the ones to capture users?
description: If the new device turns out to be a niche product, it would leave Apple in the same bind as other major tech companies.

title: US and Chinese officials hold ‘candid’ talks in Beijing
description: Mid-level talks in Beijing mark continuing diplomacy despite rising tensions and competition between US and China.

title: Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh’s ‘hot zone for climate threats’
description: Extreme weather is bearing down on vulnerable Rohingya communities on southeastern Bangladesh's coast.

title: Will fossil fuel phase-out make it onto the UN’s climate agenda?
description: UN climate chief says while the rapid end of hydrocarbon use is required, the idea may not be discussed at COP28 talks.

title: Death toll reaches 42 as Haiti inundated by deadly floods
description: Thousands have been displaced and dozens killed by flooding as country reels from climate change and political crisis.

title: As US aims to bring back manufacturing, supporting women is key
description: In Asia, women factory workers powered manufacturing growth. Are there lessons there for the US?

title: Bangladesh facing more power cuts amid fuel shortage
description: Bangladesh shut its biggest power plant because it was unable to afford the coal to fuel it amid a heatwave.

title: Mexico ruling party wins governor’s race in most populous state
description: The victory of President Lopez Obrador's MORENA party in the state of Mexico bodes well for presidential poll next year.

title: One year after killings in Brazil’s Amazon, tensions run high
description: Defence of Indigenous lands in Brazil still poses many dangers, a year after killing of Bruno Pereira and Dom Phillips.

title: US SEC sues world’s largest crypto exchange Binance and founder
description: SEC says Binance and its CEO secretly control customers’ assets, allowing them to commingle and divert customer funds.

title: US committed to Saudi-Israeli normalisation, Blinken tells AIPAC
description: Antony Blinken tells lobby group that ties between Israel and Saudi Arabia are in 'national security interest' of US.

title: In Somalia, the rains have come but the crisis is far from over
description: Somalia needs urgent humanitarian aid and long-term climate financing to ensure the wellbeing of its children.

title: Almost Zlatan: Ibrahimovic’s ex-teammate on a sliding doors story
description: A childhood friend and former teammate speaks to Al Jazeera about how Zlatan Ibrahimovic got his big break.

title: Top EU court rules Poland’s justice reforms infringe EU law
description: European Commission brought case over 2019 changes that bar Polish courts from applying EU law in some cases.

title: Iran to reopen embassy in Saudi Arabia after seven years
description: The move comes in accordance with a China-brokered agreement between Tehran and Riyadh.

title: AI-generated content should be labelled, EU commissioner says
description: Vera Jourova, deputy head of the European Commission, says safeguards need to be put in place to counter disinformation.

title: ‘The proof we were missing’: ‘Death flight’ returns to Argentina
description: A plane used to execute prisoners during Argentina’s dictatorship is set to be repatriated after being rediscovered.

title: Greek NGO leads ‘crazy’ bid to rid Mediterranean of plastic waste
description: A fifth-generation fisherman finds an innovative way to remove and recycle plastic waste from the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Could Spain’s far-right Vox party win July 23 snap elections?
description: Polls indicate that Spain's ultraconservative party could become the kingmaker of the national government.

title: A firsthand view of a migrant’s journey to the United States
description: Meet Felipe, a migrant from Colombia who crossed two of the most dangerous obstacles on the migrant trail.

title: Sanctions on Russia may not be working, we now know why
description: European businesses and third countries are actively circumventing sanctions, providing Russia with critical goods.

title: Pakistani motorcyclist completes ‘friendship tour’ of India
description: Pakistani vlogger Abrar Hassan took a motorbike trip around India.

title: Classic car owners modernise with electric conversions
description: Classic car owners in the United States are swapping their petrol engines for electric motors.

title: Displaced Syrian boy creates stunning homemade toys from scraps
description: A 12-year-old Syrian boy is making his own toys by recycling the scrap materials he finds in his camp.

title: Sidon, Lebanon’s youngest tour guide
description: “A genius in old Sidon.”

title: They wait for bodies of loved ones killed in India train crash
description: People spend days on desperate journeys from neighbouring states to identify bodies as process stretches into third day.

title: Oil rises on Saudi plan to deepen output cuts from July
description: Saudi Arabia's plan to voluntarily cut production is on top of OPEC+ deal to limit supply next year to prop up prices.

title: Australian woman jailed for 20 years for children deaths pardoned
description: New scientific evidence shows Kathleen Folbigg's four children may have died of natural causes as she had claimed.

title: India, US agree on road map for defence industry cooperation
description: Agreement comes weeks before Indian PM visits Washington for an official state visit and talks with the US president.

title: Belgium probes alleged use of its weapons in attack on Russia
description: A report claimed military aid given to Ukraine by NATO countries were used by pro-Ukraine fighters to attack Russia.

title: Amnesty calls for global action to mitigate heatwaves in Pakistan
description: In its report to mark World Environment Day, the rights group says Pakistan is at the 'frontline of the climate crisis'.

title: AC Milan striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic retires from football at 41
description: Sweden's all-time top scorer has played for some of Europe's biggest clubs including Juventus, Barcelona, PSG and Milan.

title: Visualising the growth of the electric car industry
description: Every three in 20 cars sold worldwide in 2022 were electric, with more than half of them sold in China alone.

title: Probe into India rail disaster begins as train services resume
description: Official investigation into India's deadliest rail crash in 20 years begins as trains cross the disaster spot in Odisha.

title: US video shows close call with Chinese warship in Taiwan Strait
description: The US Navy releases a video showing Chinese warship nearly hit US destroyer in the Taiwan Strait on the weekend.

title: PwC Australia names staff involved in government tax plan leak
description: 'Big four' audit firm is embroiled in controversy after former partner leaked information about changes to tax law.

title: Lung cancer pill cuts risk of death by half, study finds
description: The drug, developed by AstraZeneca, if taken daily after surgery, dramatically reduces risk of death, study shows.

title: China scaling back spending in Southeast Asia, report says
description: Asian Development Bank and World Bank have overtaken China as top source of development funding, think tank says.

title: US fighter jets chase small plane over Washington, DC
description: The plane with an unresponsive pilot later crashed in Virginia. No survivors were found at the scene, officials say.

title: Journalist Bao Choy wins appeal at Hong Kong’s top court
description: Court of Final Appeal overturns conviction saying a 'substantial and grave injustice' had been done.

title: Dozens arrested in Hong Kong on Tiananmen crackdown anniversary
description: Woman carrying flowers, man holding a candle among dozens arrested as Hong Kong cracks down on Tiananmen commemorations.

title: Singapore’s soaring costs drive expats to Malaysia, Vietnam
description: Lower living costs in cities such as Kuala Lumpur and Ho Chi Minh are attracting some expats away from Singapore.

title: US, UK navies say responded to call from ship in Strait of Hormuz
description: US Navy said the merchant ship was being 'harassed' by boats from Iran's Revolutionary Guard.

title: Russia claims to have thwarted major Ukraine attack
description: Claim comes as Ukraine prepares for a major counteroffensive to retake territory occupied by Russia.

title: New Zealand pilot kidnapping exposes Indonesia’s Papua ‘hotspot’
description: The incident in a remote highlands region has drawn renewed attention to one of the world's least-known conflicts.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 467
description: As the war enters its 467th day, here's a look at the main developments.
